content:
Congratulations on successfully repotting your fiddle leaf fig tree! It's great to hear that it's doing well so far.

Spending an hour and a half on the project was definitely worth it, considering the care and attention to detail you showed in handling the roots and adding fertilizer to the new soil. That's exactly what your plant needed to thrive in its new home.

By taking the time to gently handle the roots and prune away any dead or damaged roots, you've given your fiddle leaf fig tree a fresh start. And by adding fertilizer to the new soil, you've provided it with the necessary nutrients to support healthy growth and development.

Now, keep an eye on your plant's progress and make any necessary adjustments to its care. Make sure to monitor its watering needs, as they may change over time. And don't hesitate to prune your fiddle leaf fig tree regularly to maintain its shape and encourage new growth.

Remember, repotting can be a stressful experience for plants, so it's normal for them to take a little time to adjust. But with proper care and attention, your fiddle leaf fig tree should continue to thrive and bring beauty and freshness to your space.

How's the rest of your plant collection doing? Are there any other plants that need repotting or require special care?
